SEARCH
Package entity

Interface Assignable

All Superinterfaces:
Bean, com.guidewire.pl.persistence.core.BeanMethods, BundleProvider, Comparable<Bean>
All Known Subinterfaces:
CCAssignable, UserRoleAssignmentDelegate
All Known Implementing Classes:
Activity, Claim, Exposure, Matter, ServiceRequest, Subrogation, UserRoleAssignment
@Generated(value="com.guidewire.pl.metadata.codegen.Codegen", comments="Assignable.eti;Assignable.eix;Assignable.etx") public interface Assignable extends Bean
Assignable A delegate containing common fields used by all assignable entities. These fields track:
  • The assignment status ("Assigned", "Unassigned" and so on)
  • The current assignee - a queue or user and their corresponding group
  • The previous assignee - a queue or user and their corresponding group
  • The user who last assigned the entity
  • The time when the entity was last assigned
If an entity is assigned to a queue then the assigned group will be the queue's group. If an entity is assigned to a user then the assigned group will be one of the user's groups. Do not assign an entity to both a user and a queue. If an entity is assigned to a group it will usually also be assigned to a user or queue, though while assignment rules are running it may temporarily be assigned to just a group.

  • Method Details

    • assign

      boolean assign(Group group, User user)
      Directly assigns the entity to the specified group and user by setting the assignedGroup and assignedUser fields. If user or group is null returns false and nothing is done.
      Parameters:
      group - The group to which the entity should be assigned
      user - The user to which the entity should be assigned
      Returns:
      true if the assignment is successful

    • assign

      void assign(Key groupID, Key userID) throws com.guidewire.pl.system.exception.NoAssignmentFoundException, com.guidewire.pl.system.exception.IllegalAssignmentException
      Deprecated.
      Use autoAssign(Group, User) instead. Note that that method returns a boolean instead of throwing exceptions

      Invokes the Assignment Engine to assign the item to the specified group and user. If userID is null, the item will be assigned using the group's assignment rules. If userID is specified, assignment will be made directly to the group and user. If the engine cannot assign the item to the requested group/user, it will throw an exception indicating the reason.

      If a user is specified, caller is responsible for ensuring that the user is a member of group.

      Note that since this method invokes the Assignment Engine, it may not be called from within an Assignment rule.
      Parameters:
      groupID - The group to which the item should be assigned - must be specified. If not known, use autoAssign(item) instead.
      userID - The user to which the item should be assigned; if null an appropriate user will be selected by group assignment rules.
      Throws:
      com.guidewire.pl.system.exception.IllegalAssignmentException - if the user does not have permission
      com.guidewire.pl.system.exception.NoAssignmentFoundException - if assignment could not be made

    • assignActivityToQueue

      boolean assignActivityToQueue(AssignableQueue queue)
      Deprecated.
      use assignActivityToQueue(AssignableQueue, Group) instead, since that method is more widely valid and is easier to understand because the group is explicit rather than implicit.
      Assign the entity, which must be an Activity to the specified queue. (Currently, only Activities may be assigned to Queues.) The current group is not a parameter - it is derived from the current Assignment Engine state. As a result, this method may only be invoked from within an Assignment Rule.

      If there is no current group, nothing is done and a warning is logged. The queue must belong to the current group or nothing is done. Returns false if the assignable bean is not an activity.

      If invoked from outside an Assignment Rule, will take no action and return false.

      Parameters:
      queue - Queue to assign the activity to
      Returns:
      true if the assignment is successful, false otherwise

    • assignActivityToQueue

      boolean assignActivityToQueue(AssignableQueue queue, Group group)
      Assign this entity, which must be an Activity, to the specified queue. The queue should belong to the specified group. Returns false if the assignable bean is not an activity.
      Parameters:
      queue - Queue to assign the activity to
      group - cannot be null
      Returns:
      true if the assignment is successful

    • assignByUserAttributes

      boolean assignByUserAttributes(AttributeBasedAssignmentCriteria attributeBasedAssignmentCriteria)
      Deprecated.
      depends on the Assignment Engine state; use assignByUserAttributes(AttributeBasedAssignmentCriteria, boolean, Group) instead
      Assigns an assignable item to the user who best fits the set of user attributes defined in the attributeBasedAssignmentCriteria parameter. Alternative signature which depends on the "current" group status in the Assignment Engine; see the preferred method for details.

      If invoked from outside an Assignment Rule, will take no action and return false.

      Parameters:
      attributeBasedAssignmentCriteria - The criteria used to perform the search
      Returns:
      true if the assignment is successful, false otherwise

    • assignByUserAttributes

      boolean assignByUserAttributes(AttributeBasedAssignmentCriteria attributeBasedAssignmentCriteria, boolean includeSubGroups)
      Deprecated.
      depends on the Assignment Engine state; use assignByUserAttributes(AttributeBasedAssignmentCriteria, boolean, Group) instead
      Assigns an assignable item to the user who best fits the set of user attributes defined in the attributeBasedAssignmentCriteria parameter. Alternative signature which depends on the "current" group status in the Assignment Engine; see the preferred method for details.

      If invoked from outside an Assignment Rule, will take no action and return false.

      Parameters:
      attributeBasedAssignmentCriteria - The criteria used to perform the search
      includeSubGroups - if true, searches all the users in any subgroups of the current group, as well as those in the current group. If false, only searches users in the current group
      Returns:
      true if the assignment is successful, false otherwise

    • assignByUserAttributes

      boolean assignByUserAttributes(AttributeBasedAssignmentCriteria attributeBasedAssignmentCriteria, boolean includeSubGroups, Group group)
      Assigns an assignable item to a user who satisfies the constraints defined in the attributeBasedAssignmentCriteria parameter. This is done by:

      1) Find the set of users who are members of the supplied group, and optionally its subgroups, and who satisfy the supplied attribute-based search criteria. (If the group parameter is null, then no group restriction applies) 2) Select from the resulting set of users via the round-robin rotation mechanism. A separate round-robin state will be maintained for each unique assignment criteria entity and group.

      Parameters:
      attributeBasedAssignmentCriteria - the criteria to be satisfied by the selected user
      includeSubGroups - if true, searches all the users in any subgroups of the group parameter as well as those in that group. If false, only searches users in the group
      group - the group.
      Returns:
      true if the assignment is successful, false otherwise

    • assignGroup

      boolean assignGroup(Group group)
      Assigns the entity to the group requested. If group is null, nothing is done.
      Parameters:
      group - the group to which the entity should be assigned
      Returns:
      true if the assignment is successful, false otherwise

    • assignGroupByGroupType

      boolean assignGroupByGroupType(GroupType requiredGroupType)
      Deprecated.
      This method of assignment is deemed useless, because it always returns the first group found with the required type. Use assignGroupByRoundRobin() instead, so that the assignment will be rotated among the matching groups.
      Uses the group type group selector to choose the next subgroup under the "current" group (retrieved from the current state of the Assignment Engine) to receive the assignable. If there is no current group, the root group from the Assignment Engine is used.

      This method will search breadth-first through the group tree, starting with the current group, and will return the first group found with the approriate type.

      If invoked from outside an Assignment Rule, will take no action and return false.

      Parameters:
      requiredGroupType - A GroupType typecode; the assignment will be restricted to a group of this type. If null, then no group will be found.
      Returns:
      true if the assignment is successful, false otherwise

    • assignGroupByLocation

      boolean assignGroupByLocation(GroupType groupType, Address address, boolean directChildrenOnly)
      Deprecated.
      Use assignGroupByLocation(GroupType, Address, boolean, Group) insteaed, to make the recursion explicit.
      Assigns this entity to a group based on region assignments. This is done in the following manner:

      Alternative signature; see assignGroupByLocation(GroupType, Address, boolean, Group) for more details.

      If invoked from outside an Assignment Rule, will take no action and return false.

      Parameters:
      groupType - Only groups whose GroupType property matches this value will be considered
      address - An address to use for location-based assignment
      directChildrenOnly - if this parameter is false the selector will round-robin not only through the current group but also through all its subgroups.
      Returns:
      true if the assignment is successful, false otherwise

    • assignGroupByLocation

      boolean assignGroupByLocation(GroupType groupType, Address address, boolean directChildrenOnly, Group parentGroup)
      Assigns this entity to a group based on region assignments. This is done in the following manner:

      1) Based on the Region configuration, get the smallest zone containing the supplied address (in the US, this would typically be the zip code) 2) Search for the groups within the parameter group whose region assignment configuration includes that zip code. 3) If no group is found, repeat steps 1 and 2 with the next largest zone (in the US, county) 4) If no group is found, repeat steps 1 and 2 with the next largest zone (in the US, state) 5) If more than one group is found, then round-robin among the resulting groups based on the zone which was used to find the match.

      For example if we find no groups that match by zip but a few that match by county then assignment will round robin through the ones that match by county and will ignore any others that match by state. Matching is case-insensitive.

      Search is restricted to the sub-groups of the specified group and optionally all of its children. If there is no specified group, then the root group is used. Note that starting from the root group is potentially costly in performance time. If invoked from outside an Assignment Rule, this method will take no action and return false.

      Parameters:
      groupType - Only groups whose GroupType property matches this value will be considered
      address - An address to use for location-based assignment
      directChildrenOnly - if this parameter is false the selector will round-robin not only through the parameter group but also through all its subgroups.
      parentGroup - The group whose subgroups will be considered for assignment
      Returns:
      true if the assignment is successful, false otherwise

    • assignGroupByRoundRobin

      boolean assignGroupByRoundRobin(GroupType requiredGroupType)
      Deprecated.
      Use assignGroupByRoundRogin(GroupType, boolean, Group) insteaed, to make the recursion explicit.
      Uses the round robin group selector to choose the next subgroup under the current group with the appropriate type to be assigned to this entity.

      Alternative signature; see assignGroupByRoundRobin(GroupType, boolean, Group) for more details.

      If invoked from outside an Assignment Rule, will take no action and return false.

      Parameters:
      requiredGroupType - A typecode for a group; the assignment will be restricted to a group of this type. If null, then no group will be found
      Returns:
      true if the assignment is successful, false otherwise

    • assignGroupByRoundRobin

      boolean assignGroupByRoundRobin(GroupType requiredGroupType, boolean includeSubGroups)
      Deprecated.
      Use assignGroupByRoundRobin(GroupType, boolean, Group) insteaed, to make the recursion explicit.
      Uses the round robin group selector to choose the next subgroup under the current group with the appropriate type to be assigned to this entity.

      Alternative signature; see assignGroupByRoundRobin(GroupType, boolean, Group) for more details.

      If invoked from outside an Assignment Rule, will take no action and return false.

      Parameters:
      requiredGroupType - A typecode for a group; the assignment will be restricted to a group of this type. If null, then no group will be found
      includeSubGroups - If true, all the user
      Returns:
      true if the assignment is successful, false otherwise

    • assignGroupByRoundRobin

      boolean assignGroupByRoundRobin(GroupType groupType, boolean includeSubGroups, Group parentGroup)
      Uses the round robin algorithm to choose the next group to receive the assignable.

      The round-robin algorithm is basically a simple "eenie-meenie-miney-moe" rotation. No current assignment load is taken into account, but each Group's load factor is used to determine relative assignment frequency; essentially, a group with a lower load factor than the others' is periodically skipped.

      The round-robin rotation for each group type (and boolean value) is independent of the others, so only identical calls will impact the user who is "next" in the rotation.

      If no group is specified, the root group will be used instead. Note that starting from the root group is potentially costly in performance time.

      When group type is specified, the load factor is NOT used.

      Parameters:
      groupType - Only groups whose GroupType property matches this value will be considered
      includeSubGroups - if this parameter is true the selector will round-robin not only through the parameter group's immediate children but also through all its subgroups.
      parentGroup - The group whose subgroups will be considered for assignment
      Returns:
      true if the assignment is successful, false otherwise

    • assignGroupDynamically

      boolean assignGroupDynamically(DynamicGroupAssignmentStrategy dynamicGroupAssignmentStrategy, Group parentGroup, boolean includeSubGroups)
      Uses the supplied dynamic assignment strategy implementation to find a group assignment for the current entity. See DynamicGroupAssignmentStrategy for more details on what that implementation should look like and how it is used by the implementation of this method.
      Parameters:
      dynamicGroupAssignmentStrategy - the DynamicGroupAssignmentStrategy to be used to do the assignment
      parentGroup - The group to be used during the assignment (usually the parent group to which the entity is or should be assigned)
      includeSubGroups - Whether the subgroups of the supplied group should also be considered
      Returns:
      true if the assignment is successful, false otherwise

    • assignToCreator

      boolean assignToCreator(Editable sourceEntity)
      Assigns the item to the creator of the supplied entity, and to one of the user's groups. If no group is found for the user, uses the group based on the rule engine state (if available).
      Parameters:
      sourceEntity - The entity to query for the id of the creator.
      Returns:
      true if the assignment is successful, false otherwise

    • assignToCreator

      boolean assignToCreator(Editable sourceEntity, Group defaultGroup)
      Deprecated.
      This signature is a little confusing, because the defaultGroup parameter should almost never be necessary, since in the current system a user almost never belongs to no groups. Use assignToCreator(EditableBean) instead
      Assigns this entity to the user who created the supplied entity, and to the first group in the user's list of member groups. In the unlikely case that the user does not belong to any groups, then the entity will be assigned to the supplied default group.

      If the supplied entity has not been persisted yet, and therefore has no recorded creator, then the current user will be used instead.

      Parameters:
      sourceEntity - The entity to query for the id of its creator.
      defaultGroup - The default group to use if the assigned user is not a member of any group.
      Returns:
      true if the assignment is successful, false otherwise

    • assignToFNOLQueue

      boolean assignToFNOLQueue()
      Deprecated.
      use assignActivityToQueue(entity.AssignableQueue) to assign an activity to a particular queue. Note that Group.getQueue(String) can be used to find a named queue.
      Another name for assignToQueue(), making it more explicit that the activity will be assigned to the FNOL queue. See that method for more details.
      Returns:
      true if the assignment is successful, false otherwise

    • assignToIssueOwner

      boolean assignToIssueOwner()
      Assigns this entity to the user and group to which the entity's "issue" is assigned. Which entity is used to find the user and group is application-dependent. For example, in CC this will assign the entity to the owner of the related exposure (if any) or claim. This method is currently only meaningful for CC.
      Returns:
      true if the assignment is successful, false otherwise

    • assignToQueue

      boolean assignToQueue()
      Deprecated.
      use assignActivityToQueue(entity.AssignableQueue) to assign an activity to a particular queue. Note that Group.getQueue(String) can be used to find a named queue.
      Assign an activity to the FNOL queue of items assigned to the "current" group (retrieved from the current state of the Assignment Engine). If the entity to be assigned is not an activity nothing is done, false is returned and a warning is logged.

      If invoked from outside an Assignment Rule, will take no action and return false.

      Returns:
      true if the assignment is successful, false otherwise

    • assignUser

      boolean assignUser(User user)
      Deprecated.
      depends on the Assignment Engine state; use assign(Group, User) instead
      Assigns the entity to the user requested within the "current" group (retrieved from the current state of the Assignment Engine). If the user is null or is not a member of the current group, nothing is done and false is returned.

      If invoked from outside an Assignment Rule, will take no action and return false.

      Parameters:
      user - the user to be assigned
      Returns:
      true if the assignment is successful

    • assignUserAndDefaultGroup

      boolean assignUserAndDefaultGroup(User user)
      Directly assigns the entity to the specified user and one of the groups the user belongs to.

      If the user does not have sufficient permission to accept the assignment, false is returned

      Parameters:
      user - The user to which the entity should be assigned
      Returns:
      true if the assignment is successful, false otherwise

    • assignUserByLocation

      boolean assignUserByLocation(Address address)
      Deprecated.
      depends on the Assignment Engine state; use assignUserByLocation(Address, boolean, Group) instead.
      Uses the location-based assigner to assign an Assignable based on a given address.

      Alternative signature; see assignUserByLocation(Address, boolean, Group) for more details.

      If invoked from outside an Assignment Rule, will take no action and return false.

      Parameters:
      address - An address to use for location-based assignment
      Returns:
      true if the assignment is successful, false otherwise

    • assignUserByLocation

      boolean assignUserByLocation(Address address, boolean includeSubGroups)
      Deprecated.
      depends on the Assignment Engine state; use assignUserByLocation(Address, boolean, Group) instead.
      Uses the location-based assigner to assign an Assignable based on a given address.

      Alternative signature; see assignUserByLocation(Address, boolean, Group) for more details.

      If invoked from outside an Assignment Rule, will take no action and return false.

      Parameters:
      address - An address to use for location-based assignment
      includeSubGroups - if true, then include users in any sub groups of the current group as well as users in the current group.
      Returns:
      true if the assignment is successful, false otherwise

    • assignUserByLocation

      boolean assignUserByLocation(Address address, boolean includeSubGroups, Group group)
      Assigns this entity to a user based on region assignments. This is done in the following manner:

      1) Based on the Region configuration, get the smallest zone containing the supplied address (in the US, this would typically be the zip code) 2) Search for the users whose region assignment configuration includes that zip code. 3) If no user is found, repeat steps 1 and 2 with the next largest zone (in the US, county) 4) If no user is found, repeat steps 1 and 2 with the next largest zone (in the US, state) 5) If more than one user is found, then round-robin among the resulting users based on the zone which was used to find the match.

      For example if we find no users that match by zip but a few that match by county then assignment will round robin through the ones that match by county and will ignore any others that match by state. Matching is case-insensitive.

      Search is restricted to the users of the group (and optionally its subgroups). It is an error if there is no group.

      Parameters:
      address - An address to use for location-based assignment
      includeSubGroups - if true, then include users in any sub groups of the parameter group as well as users in that group.
      group - the group whose users will be considered for the assignment
      Returns:
      true if the assignment is successful, false otherwise

    • assignUserByLocationAndAttributes

      boolean assignUserByLocationAndAttributes(Address address, AttributeBasedAssignmentCriteria attributeBasedAssignmentCriteria, boolean includeSubGroups)
      Deprecated.
      depends on the Assignment Engine state; use assignUserByLocationAndAttributes(Address, AttributeBasedAssignmentCriteria, boolean, Group) instead.
      A combination of assignUserByLocation(entity.Address) and assignByUserAttributes(entity.AttributeBasedAssignmentCriteria) .

      Alternative signature; see assignUserByLocationAndAttributes(Address, AttributeBasedAssignmentCriteria, boolean, Group) for more details.

      If invoked from outside an Assignment Rule, will take no action and return false.

      Parameters:
      address - An address to use for location-based assignment
      attributeBasedAssignmentCriteria - the user attributes to match against
      includeSubGroups - if true, then include users in any sub groups of the current group as well as users in the current group.
      Returns:
      true if the assignment is successful, false otherwise

    • assignUserByLocationAndAttributes

      boolean assignUserByLocationAndAttributes(Address address, AttributeBasedAssignmentCriteria attributeBasedAssignmentCriteria, boolean includeSubGroups, Group group)
      Assigns this entity to the user matching the attribute criteria whose region assignments contain the supplied location. This method first finds the users in the supplied group (and, possibly, subgroups) who match the attribute criteria, and then once that set is determined it applies the same algorithm used by assignUserByLocation(entity.Address) to find a user whose region assignments contain the supplied location.

      If no users match the supplied criteria, then assignment will fail and false will be returned.

      Parameters:
      address - An address to use for location-based assignment
      attributeBasedAssignmentCriteria - the user attributes to match against
      includeSubGroups - if true, then include users in any sub groups of the parameter group as well as users in that group.
      group - the group whose members should be considered for the assignment
      Returns:
      true if the assignment is successful, false otherwise

    • assignUserByRoundRobin

      boolean assignUserByRoundRobin()
      Deprecated.
      depends on the Assignment Engine state; use assignUserByRoundRobin(boolean, Group) instead
      Assigns a user within the "current" group (retrieved from the current state of the Assignment Engine), rotating through the set of users in the group each time the method is called.

      Alternative signature; see assignUserByRoundRobin(boolean, Group) for more details.

      If invoked from outside an Assignment Rule, will take no action and return false.

      Returns:
      true if the assignment is successful, false otherwise

    • assignUserByRoundRobin

      boolean assignUserByRoundRobin(boolean includeSubGroups)
      Deprecated.
      depends on the Assignment Engine state; use assignUserByRoundRobin(boolean, Group) instead
      Assigns a user within the "current" group (retrieved from the current state of the Assignment Engine), rotating through the set of users in the group each time the method is called.

      Alternative signature; see assignUserByRoundRobin(boolean, Group) for more details.

      If invoked from outside an Assignment Rule, will take no action and return false.

      Parameters:
      includeSubGroups - if this parameter is true the selector will round-robin not only through the current group but also through all its subgroups.
      Returns:
      true if the assignment is successful, false otherwise

    • assignUserByRoundRobin

      boolean assignUserByRoundRobin(boolean includeSubGroups, Group group)
      Uses the round robin algorithm to choose the next user from the specified group or to receive the assignable.

      The round-robin algorithm is basically a simple "eenie-meenie-miney-moe" rotation. No current assignment load is taken into account, but each User's load factor is used to determine relative assignment frequency; essentially, a user with a lower load factor than the others' is periodically skipped.

      The round-robin rotation for each group (and boolean value) is independent of the others, so only identical calls will impact the user who is "next" in the rotation.

      Parameters:
      includeSubGroups - if this parameter is true the selector will round-robin not only through the parameter group but also through all its subgroups.
      group - may not be null
      Returns:
      true if the assignment is successful, false otherwise

    • assignUserDynamically

      boolean assignUserDynamically(DynamicUserAssignmentStrategy dynamicUserAssignmentStrategy, Group group, boolean includeSubGroups)
      Uses the supplied dynamic assignment strategy implementation to find an assignment for the current entity. See DynamicUserAssignmentStrategy for more details on what that implementation should look like and how it is used by the implementation of this method.
      Parameters:
      dynamicUserAssignmentStrategy - the DynamicUserAssignmentStrategy to be used to do the assignment
      group - The group to be used during the assignment (usually the group to which the entity is or should be assigned)
      includeSubGroups - Whether the subgroups of the supplied group should also be considered
      Returns:
      true if the assignment is successful, false otherwise

    • autoAssign

      boolean autoAssign()
      Invokes the Assignment Engine, which will process the configured Assignment Rules to come up with an assignment for the current entity.

      May not be invoked from within an Assignment Rule, since the Assignment Engine may not be invoked recursively. If invoked from within an Assigment Rule, an error will be logged and false will be returned.

      Returns:
      true if an assignment has been found, false otherwise

    • autoAssign

      boolean autoAssign(Group group, User user)

      Invokes the Assignment Enging to assign the item to the specified group and user. If userID is null, the item will be assigned using the group's assignment rules. If userID is specified, assignment will be made directly to the group and user. If the engine cannot assign the item to the requested group/user, it will throw an exception indicating the reason.

      If a user is specified, caller is responsible for ensuring that the user is a member of group.

      Note that since this method invokes the Assignment Engine, it may not be called from within an Assignment rule.
      Parameters:
      group - The group to which the item should be assigned - must be specified. If not known, use autoAssign(item) instead.
      user - The user to which the item should be assigned; if null an appropriate user will be selected by group assignment rules.
      Returns:
      true if the assignment is successufl, false otherwise

    • createUserAttributes

      AttributeBasedAssignmentCriteria createUserAttributes()
      Deprecated.
      Use the constructor directly. This method is no longer necessary, since a new AttributeBasedAssignmentCriteria entity can simply be created directly in Gosu and placed in the correct bundle.
      Creates a AttributeBasedAssignmentCriteria instance, which is used to collect a set of user attributes on which to search for users. The matchAll flag indicates whether each attribute must be satisfied (logical AND) or whether any attribute could be satisfied (logical OR).
      Returns:
      AttributeBasedAssignmentCriteria instance

    • getAssignedQueue

      AssignableQueue getAssignedQueue()
      Gets the value of the AssignedQueue field. Either the Queue to which this entity is assigned (if AssignmentStatus is 'assigned'), the Queue to which the system suggests assignment (if AssignmentStatus is 'manual'), or null if none assigned. Only one of AssignedUserID or AssignedQueueID should be non null.

    • getAssignedUser

      User getAssignedUser()
      Gets the value of the AssignedUser field. Either the User to which this entity is assigned (if AssignmentStatus is 'assigned'), the User to which the system suggests assignment (if AssignmentStatus is 'manual'), or null if none assigned. Only one of AssignedUserID or AssignedQueueID should be non null.

    • getCloseDate

      Date getCloseDate()
      Gets the value of the CloseDate field. Date and time when this entity was closed. (Not applicable to all assignable entities)

    • getCurrentAssignment

      @Deprecated Assignable getCurrentAssignment()
      Deprecated.
      depends on the Assignment Engine state; The idea of "secondary" assignment causes performance impact without adding any benefit. If used anywhere, remove “.CurrentAssignment” from the Gosu expression.
      This method exists to support the notion of "secondary" assignment in the Assignment Rules. "Secondary" assignments generally represented by UserRoleAssignment entities, are assignments of "roles" to users, separated from the single "primary" owner of the entity.

      It is generally desirable for Assignment rule writers to be able to re-use a single set of, say, Claim Assignment rules for both primary and secondary assignments. This method allows rules to be written in the form of Claim.CurrentAssignment.assignXXX() rather than Claim.assignXXX(). If the primary assignment is being performed, then getCurrentAssignment() will return the entity itself (in this case, the Claim). If a secondary assignment is being performed, then getCurrentAssignment() will return the UserRoleAssignment which is current being operated upon.

      Obviously, if an entity does not support secondary assignment (i.e. does not implement the UserRoleOwner interface), then rules do not need to use this method. Secondary assignments done outside of the Assignment Rules can simplay call the assignXXX methods directly on the UserRoleAssignment entity themselves, and therefore also do not require this method.

      Since this method is dependent on the Assignment Engine state, calling it outside of the Assignment Rules is illegal.

      Returns:
      the Assignable entity being operated on by the Assignment Engine. May be either the current entity or a UserRoleAssignment entity relating to the current entity.

    • getPreviousGroup

      Group getPreviousGroup()
      Gets the value of the PreviousGroup field. Group to which this entity was previously assigned.

      Gets the value of the PreviousQueue field. Queue to which this entity was previously assigned.
